page.title: 09An interview with Mr Thrale
page.content: Mr Thrale has been a resident of Sandridge for 6 years though his family have lived there for generations. Mr Thrale previously owned a chain of bakeries in the St.Albans area but has now sold it. His house overlooks a field in which one of the last battles of the War of the Roses was fought. Mr Thrale's family has a coat of arms. The two broad arrows were awarded to one of his ancestors by Queen Elizabeth I for sheltering her in a barn on Nomansland Common. The colours are ore and azure. The crest has an oak tree and underneath it on either side are two beer barrels which were added when his family became brewers. Below this, is a helmet with a visor down which was awarded to a gentleman.
